Dating: LATE PERIOD (not before); GRAECO-ROMAN PERIOD (not after)
Name: Amulet
Description: This small figurine in blue-green faience represents a monkey, seated on a socle, elbows on the knees and bringing the hands to the chin. It is probably  a cercopithecus monkey, a familiar animal in Ancient Egypt, which symbolised fecundity and sexual power. The ring for suspension in the nape of the neck demonstrates that the piece served as an amulet.
